RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 1 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 64. Claiming Purse 16600. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since October 8 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000, For Each $1,000 To $ 8,000 1 lb. (Races Where Entered For $6,250 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: KNOBIESMAGICSONDE pressured the pace three wide, took the nod approaching the quarter pole and left the turn clear, dug in under steady handling and drew off the final sixteenth. COWGIRL ATTITUDE set a pressured pace two deep while between horses down the backstretch, was met toward the quarter pole, raced close at the rail on the turn but flattened inside the sixteenth pole and just lasted for second. BLUE MOUNTAIN angled to the outside and gave chase, rounded the turn about the three path and just missed third in an even finish. DIVA ROSE gave chase outside, raced in the four path on the turn and ran evenly in the lane. LEMONSONDESURPRISE pressured the pace inside, steadied at the rail into the turn then faded leaving the turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Lemonsondesurprise
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace inside,steadied into turn,faded lane

ENTRY.NAME: Cowgirl Attitude
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace,met nearing 1/4,close turn,just lasted 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Knobiesmagicsonde
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Ronney W and Conrad Randall R
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace,nod nearing 1/4,clear into lane,drew off 1/16

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: James W. Shawyer & Mary Butts Shawyer

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 2 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 76. Claiming Purse 16600. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Three Races Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000, For Each $1,000 To $8,000 1 lb. (Races Where Entered For $6,250 Or Less Not Consi dered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: GAMMA SQUEEZE took a quick lead and rated the pace inside, came under pressure and turned back WINDSOR'S TRACKER leaving the three eighths pole, raced clear at the rail on the far turn and was kept alert in the lane. The latter stalked from the three path, challenged leaving the three eighths pole and raced close off the rail on the far turn, but ultimately, had to settle for second best. NO ME DIGAS stalked the early pace two deep, gave chase approaching the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn about the three path then flattened in the lane. SCHMEAR settled off the rail the first turn, gave chase leaving the three eighths pole and rounded the far turn in the two and three paths, but showed little in the lane. ONE MORE CHAPTER rounded the first turn about the four path, left the turn outside and picked up the chase nearing the three eighths pole, raced in the four path on the far turn and showed little in the stretch. DAD'S LIL SPARK bobbled at the break and was pinched back soon afterward, raced in the three path the first turn, picked up the chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole but weakened at the rail on the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Gamma Squeeze
ENTRY.COMMENT: quick lead,rated pace inside,pressured 3/8,kept alert lane

ENTRY.NAME: Schmear
ENTRY.COMMENT: off rail,chased 3/8,2& 3p far turn,little in lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 3 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 52. Maiden Claiming Purse 16600. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, FILLIES TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 122 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500, if for $10,000, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MISS INTENSITY gave chase through the backstretch, raced in the four path on the turn, left the turn outside and dug in under steady encouragement to take over the final strides. YES TO LOVE gave chase and raced close in the three path on the turn, was outfinished in the duel through the stretch but got up for second the final strides. THETA contested the pace at mostly even terms and took the nod into the lane, dug in to draw briefly clear past the sixteenth pole but was outfinished in the final strides. SOMESUGARNSPICE gave chase, raced at the rail on the turn and ran evenly in the lane. ANOTHER FINE JUBA contested the pace at mostly even terms and had the edge at the rail into the turn, but flattened leaving the eighth pole. WAY OF APPEAL gave chase through the backstretch, rounded the turn off the rail and showed little in the lane. LEONESSA hesitated and came away a bit rank and never factored.

ENTRY.NAME: Another Fine Juba
ENTRY.COMMENT: contested pace,edge rail into turn,flattened lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 4 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 67. Claiming Purse 13700. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE MAY 8, 2023 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since October 8 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CRUZ IN THE CASTLE accelerated to the lead inside approaching the five sixteenths pole and contested the edge nearest the rail on the turn, raced clear leaving the eighth pole and held well under steady handling. AT THE HALF gave chase inside, rounded the turn at the rail then eased out past the eighth pole and dug in to take second the final strides. THUNDER PUNCH set a pressured early pace then gave chase from the five sixteenths pole, raced at a close disadvantage two deep on the turn but dropped back past the eighth pole and was nipped from second the final strides. EMBERLY chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn about the three path, steadied leaving the eighth pole but came back to finish evenly. SISTER JOANN gave chase through the backstretch, rounded the turn about the four path, left the turn outside and showed little more. ULTRA DIVA was not a factor. MISS GRANDSTANDER was taken up shortly after the start and walked off post race. The Stewards reviewed then rejected a claim of foul against the rider of At The Half for alleged interference leaving the turn, lodged by the rider of Emberly.

ENTRY.NAME: At the Half
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased inside,rail turn,eased out past 1/8,up 2nd late

ENTRY.NAME: Cruz in the Castle
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled up near 5/16,edge rail turn,clear past 1/8,driving

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 5 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 62. Maiden Special Weight Purse 26500. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 120 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MITOLE'S BAYTOWN rated a slim lead inside and kept the edge over A LOTTA MOXIE leaving the seven sixteenths pole, came under pressure leaving the five sixteenths, raced at the rail on the far turn and was steadily handled to hold on. The latter stalked two deep, challenged leaving the seven sixteenths pole and contested at a close disadvantage through the far turn and was outfinished in the duel through the stretch. OREO ANGEL settled off the rail the first turn, gave chase leaving the three eighths pole and entered the far turn at the rail, angled out midway through the turn and finished evenly at the outside flank of the runner-up. RAGAZZA MIA saved ground, picked up the chase from the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn near the rail and weakened in the lane. OLD FASHIONED GIRL stalked the early pace from the four path, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole but weakened in the four path on the far turn. COLLECTED SUCCESS became fractious in the gate and angled to the five path into the first turn, left the turn outside and gave chase to no avail leaving the seven sixteenths pole. BRASSIC stalked from the three path the first turn then weakened leaving the three eighths pole.

ENTRY.NAME: Mitole's Baytown
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated slim lead,kept edge from 7/16,pressured 5/16,held on drving

ENTRY.NAME: Oreo Angel
ENTRY.COMMENT: off rail 1st turn,chased 3/8,angled out mid turn,even finish

ENTRY.NAME: Collected Success
ENTRY.OWNER: JTK Racehorse LLC and Klingler Thoroughbreds LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: fractious in gate,5p into 1st turn,chased 7/16,no avail

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 6 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 81. Allowance Purse 27400. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since September 8 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Consi dered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BELLA MELA contested the pace at even terms, took the nod at the quarter pole, dueled clear nearing mid-stretch and widened the final sixteenth. MACKENZIE'S MUSIC gave chase through the backstretch, rounded the turn in the three path and dug in to take second the final strides. KEEP ON SPURRIN raced with the pace inside, ceded the edge to Bella Mela at the quarter pole, continued close at the rail on the turn but dropped back nearing mid-stretch and just lasted for third. TIMETOGETUP gave chase toward the outside, raced in the four path on the turn and just missed third in an even finish. SNOWY JUBA CAT hesitated at the break, gave chase through the backstretch and raced near the rail on the turn. CAST NO STONES gave early chase outside and rounded the turn about the three path.

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 7 7F Dirt CR: 89. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 24000. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, WAIVER CLAIMING OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $15,000. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-win ners Of A Race Since October 8 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since September 8 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $15,000 (Races Where Entered For $10,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: NEVER COMPROMISE saved ground off the pace, started a bid leaving the three eighths pole, angled to the four path approaching the head of the lane, left the turn outside, dug in for the lead mid-stretch and widened later yards. GOLDEN APPEAL raced off the rail the first turn, started a four wide bid leaving the three eighths pole, contested even terms three wide on the far turn and dueled through the stretch for second. AUBURN MILL took the lead and moved to the inside to rate the pace, came under pressure leaving the three eighths pole, contested the edge at the rail on the far turn but was met mid-stretch and relented in the duel for second. REMYS SHOWTIME stalked the early pace three wide, gave chase leaving the three eighths pole and contested at a close disadvantage between horses on the far turn, though, flattened the final sixteenth. RIP THORN saved ground. MISS WAVE stalked the early pace two deep, gave chase toward the seven sixteenths pole but was taken up approaching the five sixteenths and walked off.

ENTRY.NAME: Never Compromise
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,bid 3/8,angled 4p far turn,up 1/16,widened late yrds

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 8 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 55. Maiden Claiming Purse 13000. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 121 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $7,500, if for $7,000, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: J. WICK gave chase through the backstretch and improved four wide on the turn, took the nod entering the stretch, dueled clear past the sixteenth pole and held well under steady handling. DOG TOWN ALLEN contested the early pace and took the lead three wide approaching the five sixteenths pole, contested the edge off the rail on the turn but was met entering the stretch and relented the final sixteenth. LAST PARTY contested the pace between horses through the backstretch, but checked approaching the quarter pole, resumed his efforts two deep past the pole and held on for third. JUBA'S YANKEE ONE came away sharply with a brief lead then gave chase outside leaving the half mile pole, rounded the turn about the five path and ran evenly in the lane. MYLASHURRAH contested the pace inside through the backstretch but dropped back nearing the quarter pole, raced at the rail on the turn and weakened. CHARTERED COURSE gave only distant chase, raced at the rail on the turn and flattened inside the eighth pole. GETTIN SPICY chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn off the rail and showed little in the lane. SENZA STRIKE dwelled at the break, angled out and gave chase, but to no avail.

ENTRY.NAME: J. Wick
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Law Legacy Stables LLC & Ronney W. Brown

ENTRY.NAME: Last Party
ENTRY.OWNER: Don't Chasem Replacem Racing and Armstrong Katina M
